title.value: A Definition of Continual Reinforcement Learning
title.justification: It is explicitly stated in the beginning of the paper: 'A Definition of Continual Reinforcement Learning'
title.quote: In contrast, continual reinforcement learning refers to the setting in which the best agents never stop learning... to this end, this paper is dedicated to carefully defining the continual reinforcement learning problem.

extractions.description: The paper provides a detailed and formal definition of the Continual Reinforcement Learning (CRL) problem. It introduces a new mathematical language for analyzing and cataloging agents and defines a continual learning agent as one that carries out an implicit search process indefinitely. Further, it relates CRL to traditional views of multi-task reinforcement learning and continual supervised learning.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on providing a formal definition and mathematical framework for Continual Reinforcement Learning rather than presenting empirical results.

name.quote: A Definition of Continual Reinforcement Learning

name.justification: The focus on continual learning agents and processes positions this as a subfield within the broader reinforcement learning research.
name.quote: we define a continual learning agent as one that can be understood as carrying out an implicit search process indefinitely, and continual reinforcement learning as the setting in which the best agents are all continual learning agents.
